sop_data.question: How can I get a refund for shipping costs when a package is returned due to carrier issues?
sop: original form as received. Packaging and damaged items should not be disposed of before a claim is completed as photographs may be required. Failure to comply may result in the denial of your claim due to insufficient evidence. When filing a claim, XCover will ask to enter the re-shipping costs. This is the amount you paid for shipping a new shipment to your customer. These costs will only be refunded if this information is entered when filing the claim, and if the shipping costs were included in the

ends when your shipment has been successfully delivered to the intended recipient. What am I covered for? Shipment Protection covers your shipments against theft, loss, or damage during transit and delivery by reimbursing the sales value of the product . While the original shipping costs are not reimbursed , the policy does cover: Return shipping costs for damaged items (up to the value of the original shipping fee) Re-shipping costs for lost or stolen items (also up to the value of the original shipping

What was the value of the damaged items (optional) How much did you pay for shipping Was your parcel shipped using any other carrier(s) Have you paid for the items to be re-shipped Have you paid for the items to be return shipped Select the category of the item Tell us what happened Order invoice or summary (optional) Photo or video evidence of damage, including packaging (in case of a damaged claim) Correspondence with the customer confirming the issues with the parcels (optional) Option 2: File a claim

| Total insurance: €650 |  | Carrier refund: €250 (based on purchase value) Sendcloud Shipment Protection refund: €350 (sales value) Keep in mind that the carrier insurance claim needs to be filed separately from the claim with XCover. You can do so by going to the support section in your Sendcloud account. FAQ: Apple Account or iCloud email address I bought my protection using my Apple Account or iCloud email address. How do I activate my XCover Account? Apple has a few extra security features for users

be delivered, was refused by the customer or had an additional delivery attempt, you may be charged for these extra costs incurred. Similarly, if a parcel which is still in transport receives new instruction or a change to the address, the carrier may also charge an extra fee for this service. This is because the shipment will then need extra handling as it must be reprocessed and redelivered. If any of the above situations occur, and the carrier charges an extra fee, it will be clearly specified on your

Knockout Couture , Este mensaje y sus archivos adjuntos van dirigidos exclusivamente a su destinatario,pudiendo contener información confidencial sometida a secreto profesional.No esta permitida su reproducción o distribución sin la autorización expresa de Knockout Couture.Si usted no es el destinatario final por favor elimine e informenos por esta vía.

De acuerdo con lo establecido en el Reglamento General de Protección de Datos 2016/679 (RGPD) y la Ley Orgánica 3/2018 ,de 5 de Diciembre,de Protección de Datos Personales y Garantía de los DerechosDigitales,le informamos que trataremos sus datos personales con la finalidad de realizar la gestión administrativa ,contable y fiscal,asi como enviarle comunicaciones comerciales sobre nuestros productos y/o servicios.Los datos proporcionados se conservaran mientras se mantenga la relacion comercial o durante los años necesarios para cumplir con las obligaciones legales.Los datos no se cederán a terceros salvo en los casos que exista una obligación legal.

Asimismo,le informamos de la posibilidad de ejercer los siguientes derechos sobre sus datos personales: derecho de acceso,rectificacion,supresion u olvido,limitacion,oposicion,portabilidad y a retirar el consentimiento prestado.

Para ello podra enviar un email a: info@knockout-couture.com.Ademas ,el interesado puede dirigirse a la Autoridad de Control en materia de Protección de Datos competente para obtener información adicional o presentar una reclamación.

sop_data.question: How can I cancel my Sendcloud subscription?
sop: for you. To cancel your subscription, in your Sendcloud panel go to Account > Subscription > Click Switch to the Free > Check the box and click Deactivate . We advise you to do this as soon as possible. Otherwise, your paid subscription will automatically be renewed the next month. If you wish to delete your account instead, go to Account > Scroll down and click Delete account . Your paid subscription will expire upon the next renewal period. When you click Delete, your account will still be active during

trial period ends. Then you will be invoiced for a full year. Eg.: if your yearly subscription starts on 1 May 2022, you will be invoiced until 1 May 2023. If you do not cancel your subscription, the next invoice will follow for 2023-2024. How can I cancel my yearly subscription? We cannot end the subscription for you. To cancel your subscription, in your Sendcloud panel go to Account > Subscription > Click Switch to the Free > Check the box and click Deactivate . Your paid subscription will still be

for the lower plan will be generated. The label fee counter resets, and your next invoice includes any usage under the current plan. My trial period ends during the current month (e.g. on 20 December) and I would like to keep my monthly subscription. How will I be invoiced? We will calculate how many days are left in the month and we will invoice you accordingly. How can I cancel my monthly subscription? We cannot end the subscription for you. To cancel your subscription, in your Sendcloud panel go to

end of the invoice you will find Sendcloud's company details, including financial information and how to contact us. How to identify refunds in Sendcloud invoices If you cancel a label within 42 days, you can receive a refund from Sendcloud. The description of refund items is "credit requested for shipment". Next to it, you will see the tracking number (reference) of the shipment it refers to. Related articles: → How do we charge and invoice your shipments? → FAQ about subscription invoicing → How can I

or Premium). I would like to keep my subscription and continue shipping with Sendcloud. What do I have to do? Your plan will automatically be renewed after the trial period if you do not deactivate it. On which days will Sendcloud debit me? You will be debited for your plan once a month or once a year according to your subscription type. You will receive an email from Sendcloud, after which you will be debited. This can be immediate or take several days, depending on the country where you are based and

auto_qa_result.category: Timely and consistent communication with customers, including prompt responses, regular updates, clear expectation-setting, and follow-through on commitments.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent initiated the interaction by greeting the customer within the first 5 minutes of the conversation, demonstrating promptness and attentiveness.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Roel greeted the customer immediately after taking over the conversation, saying, 'Goededag! Ik ben Roel en ik sta je graag tot dienst!'

category_score_evaluation.legend:
'Agents must follow a 30-minute protocol for non-responsive customers:

If the customer is offline, the agent should ask for specific details to assist further.
If the customer remains unresponsive after 30 minutes, the agent should perform a probing action.'

If the agent is troubleshooting and taking time to check the issue, they should keep informed about the time taken by them.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Not Applicable

category_score_evaluation.legend: Agents must clearly state next steps, deadlines, and outcomes, use all customer-provided data, set expectations if delays occur, and remind customers WhatsApp threads remain open for replies.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Roel mentioned the article for canceling the subscription and asked the customer for their thoughts on the service, stating, 'Hiernaast kan je in dit volgende artikel terugvinden hoe je het abonnement kan opzeggen...'

auto_qa_result.category: Acknowledge information, troubleshoot fully, and provide resolution or workaround.

category_score_evaluation.legend: Agents must carefully review and acknowledge all customer-provided data (messages, attachments, screenshots, IDs) and combine it with internal resources (Scout, Helpcenter, Confluence, Tracking, Slack, carrier sites) for troubleshooting. category_score_evaluation.legend: Agents must provide correct and complete solutions whenever possible. If a final fix is unavailable, they must offer clear workarounds with next steps to guide the customer.

'Hiernaast kan je in dit volgende artikel terugvinden hoe je het abonnement kan opzeggen voor je Sendcloud account.'

auto_qa_result.category: Use empathetic, sentiment-aligned communication to build positive customer connections.

category_score_evaluation.legend: Agents must acknowledge customer emotions and concerns, using natural language with context and small personal touches to show understanding and build stronger customer relationships.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Roel acknowledged the customer's situation by expressing regret about their decision to cancel the subscription, saying, 'Het spijt me te horen dat je dit wilt.' This shows understanding of the customer's feelings and enhances rapport.

category_score_evaluation.legend: Agents must adapt tone to match the customer’s emotional state (happy, neutral, frustrated). Responses should be professional, empathetic, and context-appropriate, avoiding rudeness, sarcasm, mismatched tone, or ignoring emotions.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Roel maintained a friendly and professional tone throughout the conversation, starting with a cheerful greeting: 'Goededag! Ik ben Roel en ik sta je graag tot dienst!' and ending with a warm closing: 'Dan wens ik je toch verder nog een fijne dag & weekend.' This alignment with the customer's neutral tone was appropriate.

category_score_evaluation.legend: Agent replies must be clear, well-structured, and tailored to the specific case. Ambiguity, generic responses, or poor structuring lead to misunderstandings and negatively impact the customer experience.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Roel provided clear and structured responses to Corien's request. Additionally, he offered a relevant article link for the cancellation process, showcasing a personalized approach.

auto_qa_result.category: Deliver efficient, clear, consistent, and personalized solutions with proactive guidance.

category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Roel provided a clear response by acknowledging the customer's intention to cancel and asked for more details, showing an efficient approach. He also provided a link to the cancellation process, which is structured and relevant.

category_score_evaluation.legend: Anticipate customer needs and exceed expectations with proactive, value-added solutions.

auto_qa_result.category: Appropriate opening and closing

category_score_evaluation.legend: Agents should correctly mention the customer’s name in the greeting only if the customer has explicitly provided their name within the conversation (e.g., in the message body or signature). If the customer has not mentioned or signed their name, using a generic greeting (e.g., “Hi,” or “Hello,”) is acceptable.Agents must use a professional closing, such as “Best regards,” or “Thanks & regards,” followed by their own name.Non-compliance includes:Using the wrong name (e.g., customer signs as “Peter” but the agent says “Hi Lauren”).Using the name inferred from the email address if the customer hasn’t explicitly mentioned or signed it.Using informal or abrupt greetings/closings (e.g., “Hey,” “Hi there,” or “Thanks” without a signature).Do not deduct points if:The customer has not provided a name, and the agent uses a neutral greeting like “Hi,” or “Hello.”Example:Customer signs: “Regards, Peter.”→ Correct: “Hi Peter,”→ Incorrect: “Hi Lauren,” or no name used at all.Customer does not sign or mention their name.→ Correct: “Hi,” or “Hello,” (without assuming a name from the email address).
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Arthur properly addressed the customer as 'Debby' in the greeting, showing that he recognized her name from the previous message. His closing was professional as well, signing off with his full name and title.

auto_qa_result.category: Correct email format used

category_score_evaluation.legend: Agents must maintain proper spacing, capitalization, spelling, and punctuation throughout the email to ensure readability and professionalism. For example: no missing spaces, correct capitalization of sentences and proper nouns, and proper spelling and punctuation throughout. Non-compliance includes having 3 or more mistakes on the following: spelling or grammatical errors, improper capitalization, and missing or extra spaces between words or after punctuation.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Arthur used proper spacing, capitalization, spelling, and punctuation throughout his response. For example, he starts with a greeting, thanks the customer, and maintains a polite tone, making sure the message is clear and professional.

auto_qa_result.category: Asking for / providing sensitive information

category_score_evaluation.legend:
Agents must always handle personal and sensitive information in compliance with data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR). This means protecting customer privacy, requesting only the information strictly necessary to resolve the case, and never sharing data with unauthorized parties.
Prohibited actions (always non-compliant):Requesting or sharing sensitive data that is not essential to resolve the customer’s request.Sharing internal or confidential system information with customers.Permitted actions (compliant when relevant to the case):Agents may request or handle personal information only when it is directly necessary to perform legitimate operational tasks related to the customer’s request, such as:Delivery or address change cases: requesting or confirming the customer’s address, full name, or phone number to ensure correct delivery.Customs or shipping claims: requesting personal details (e.g., name, address, ID number) required by customs authorities to release a parcel.Integration troubleshooting: requesting access credentials, tokens, API keys, or usernames only after obtaining explicit permission from the customer, for the purpose of testing and resolving an integration failure.
N/A conditions:Mark this parameter as N/A when the exchange of sensitive data is:Necessary and relevant to the case type (e.g., address confirmation, customs documentation, or integration troubleshooting).Conducted with customer awareness and within operational or legal procedures.Non-compliance examples:Asking for banking details to issue a refund instead of processing through official channels.Requesting a password or OTP without a legitimate operational reason.Sharing another customer’s contact or parcel information.
Compliance examples:Confirming a shipping address to correct a failed delivery.Asking for permission to use provided credentials to troubleshoot a broken integration.Providing only the minimum necessary details to complete a customs form.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Not Applicable

auto_qa_result.category: Using abusive language  / Rude response

category_score_evaluation.legend: Agents must communicate respectfully, avoiding offensive, discriminatory, or aggressive language. Emails should not be rude, condescending, or use bold/ALL CAPS to emphasize points. Compliance examples include: “We understand your concern and will assist you promptly,” or “Apologies for the inconvenience caused; we are looking into this.” Non-compliance includes rude remarks, aggressive ALL CAPS, or sarcastic, discriminatory, or condescending language.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Arthur communicated respectfully and positively by thanking Debby for her message and expressing gladness about the resolution. He said, 'Wat fijn om te horen dat je zending toch boven water is gekomen!' which is a courteous and warm response.

auto_qa_result.category: Appropriate empathy/ apology/ reassurance/ acknowledgement/ rebuttal statements used

category_score_evaluation.legend: Agents must use empathetic, apologetic, reassuring, or acknowledging language as appropriate, ensuring any rebuttals are professional and non-confrontational. For instance, agents can express empathy by saying, “I understand how this may be frustrating for you,” offer an apology such as, “We apologize for the inconvenience caused,” provide reassurance with statements like, “Rest assured, we are looking into this issue,” acknowledge concerns by saying, “Thank you for bringing this to our attention,” or deliver polite rebuttals such as, “I understand your concern; however, please note that our policy states…” Non-compliance occurs when an agent ignores the user’s concern, omits necessary apologies or reassurances, or delivers rebuttals in a harsh, defensive, or confrontational tone.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Arthur acknowledged Debby’s message by expressing pleasure that her delivery issue was resolved, stating, 'Wat fijn om te horen dat je zending toch boven water is gekomen!' This shows appreciation for the customer's update and helps reinforce a positive interaction.

auto_qa_result.category: Communication followed structure, tone, and personalization standards

category_score_evaluation.legend: Agents must ensure that email communication is clear, professional, and well-structured. Messages should be organized into logical paragraphs, and the use of bullet points is encouraged when outlining steps or multiple items.The tone should remain polite, empathetic, and appropriately matched to the customer’s sentiment — reassuring when the customer is frustrated, and concise yet friendly when the customer is neutral or positive.Personalization means tailoring the message to the customer’s specific situation or inquiry, rather than using generic or template-like responses. This includes acknowledging the customer’s issue, referencing relevant details from their message, and offering solutions or updates that clearly relate to their case.Communications should be transparent, honest, and proactive — providing actionable next steps, expected timelines, and any helpful resources such as links or screenshots.Non-compliance includes:Unstructured, lengthy, or confusing text.A tone that is abrupt, dismissive, or overly casual.Generic replies that do not acknowledge the customer’s specific issue or context.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Arthur effectively acknowledged Debby's message by expressing gratitude for the update and confirming the ticket closure, which reflects a personalized and positive tone. He wrote, 'Wat fijn om te horen dat je zending toch boven water is gekomen!' which shows empathy and recognition of the customer's situation.

auto_qa_result.category: Easy to understand

category_score_evaluation.legend: Agents must use clear, concise language, avoiding technical jargon and ensuring all sentences are grammatically correct and easy to follow. For example, they can write, “We have updated your request and it should reflect shortly,” or “Please find the steps below to resolve the issue,” while avoiding terms like “JIRA ticket” or “bug” in customer-facing emails. Non-compliance includes using technical terms such as “The bug has been logged in JIRA and will be fixed in the next sprint,” writing overly complex sentences, or including grammar errors that make the email difficult to read.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Arthur communicated very clearly, saying, 'Wat fijn om te horen dat je zending toch boven water is gekomen!', which demonstrates a straightforward and positive response. Additionally, he kept the message concise and polite.

category_score_evaluation.legend: Agents must carefully review and acknowledge all customer-provided data (messages, attachments, screenshots, IDs) and combine it with internal resources (Scout, Helpcenter, Confluence, Tracking, Slack, carrier sites) for troubleshooting. category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Arthur acknowledged the customer's message about their package being received and confirmed the closure of the ticket based on this resolution. category_score_evaluation.legend: Agents must demonstrate a clear and logical approach to diagnosing and resolving the customer’s issue. This includes correctly identifying (or working toward identifying) the root cause, gathering necessary information, and testing possible solutions before escalating.Probing questions are required only when the issue is not clearly defined or when additional details are needed to confirm the root cause.If the issue is already clearly stated by the customer and the agent can proceed directly to resolution, probing questions are not required.Compliance examples include:Asking relevant clarifying questions when information is missing or ambiguous.Systematically testing possible solutions before escalating.Taking steps that logically lead to identifying or resolving the issue.Proceeding directly to resolution when the problem is already clear.Non-compliance includes:Failing to gather necessary information when the issue is unclear.Taking random or incomplete troubleshooting steps
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Arthur acknowledged that the customer's shipment issue had been resolved, stating, 'Wat fijn om te horen dat je zending toch boven water is gekomen!' He confirmed closing the ticket without any unnecessary follow-ups.

category_score_evaluation.legend:
Agents are expected to provide accurate, clear, and actionable resolutions and also provide future steps/alternatives. However, if the customer does not provide sufficient information about their issue, the agent cannot reasonably provide a resolution, and the interaction should not be flagged for deduction.Guidelines:The agent should ensure the customer knows how to proceed or follow up.If the customer leaves without providing the problem, the agent is not at fault.No deduction should be made if the agent acted professionally, provided guidance, and offered a channel for follow-up.Example When No Deduction is Needed:Customer asks a vague question (“My order isn’t working”) and agent requests clarification or directs them to a form to provide details. No deduction.Customer is temporarily unavailable, and agent leaves a polite follow-up message with instructions to continue later. No deduction.Reasoning: The customer did not provide enough details for a solution. The agent engaged politely, provided guidance, and offered next steps.
Score as N/A  if the agent asked probing questions to further clarify the situation/ issue and the customer left or never came back again to reply to those questions. Leaving the conversation unfinished.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Arthur acknowledged that the customer's issue was resolved by saying, 'Wat fijn om te horen dat je zending toch boven water is gekomen!', and closed the ticket appropriately, which shows the complete resolution was provided.

manual_qa_result.category: Workaround offered or utilized feature cross/upsell opportunity

category_score_evaluation.legend: Agents should proactively identify opportunities to guide customers toward relevant products, features, or plans that could add value to their experience. Recommendations must be personalized, addressing the customer’s specific needs, goals, or usage patterns. The intent is to enhance satisfaction and trust, not to sell unnecessarily. This parameter applies only when the customer’s inquiry or issue relates to a feature, limitation, or plan that could benefit from an alternative feature, workaround, or upgrade. If the customer’s request or problem does not allow for a relevant workaround, feature recommendation, or product suggestion (e.g., inquiries about policies, billing errors, or non-feature-related technical issues), the case should be scored as N/A.Compliance examples include: Example: “Based on your current usage, upgrading to \[Plan Name] would help you access \[specific features] that can streamline your workflow,”Suggesting an alternative feature or plan that fits the customer’s stated needs. Explaining the benefits of a feature or plan upgrade in a clear, customer-centric way. Offering a workaround when the requested feature is unavailable.Non-compliance includes: Ignoring a clear opportunity to recommend a relevant feature or plan. Recommending unrelated or generic options with no connection to the customer’s issue. Giving vague suggestions without explaining their value or relevance.Score as N/A when: The customer’s query is unrelated to product features, functionality, or plan options. No alternative product, plan, or workaround reasonably applies to the situation. Example: in a shipment claim, where the carrier has rejected the claim, there is no ethical opportunity to recommend a feature, product, or plan that adds value to the customer’s experience or if there’s no meaningful workaround to suggest — the matter is closed through compensation.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Not Applicable

sop_data.question: How to resolve a delayed shipment with UPS and track it with UPS?
sop: | Delayed, Lost, or Delivered but Not Received | Within 30 days from the date the parcel was shipped | Direct contract shipping methods If you have a direct contract with UPS, you can easily integrate it with your Sendcloud account. Our UPS contract activation guide explains how to connect your direct contract. This setup allows you to ship under your own terms and conditions. We also provide an overview of all direct contract shipping methods available through Sendcloud. Note: the conditions may vary per

available) You must send your request to UPS in writing or by telephone within 15 days of the date of the scheduled delivery and provide them with the recipient's name/address/shipping date/package weight and UPS contol number The shipment must not require any additional handling (see description on additional handling surcharge at www.ups.com ) The money-back-guarantee does not apply if the delay in delivery is due to the following circumstances: The package does not comply with the service restrictions
special handling , at their discretion. Due to the extra processing involved, no money-back guarantee applies: UPS won’t refund the shipping cost if these parcels are delayed. | €5.05 |

| Special Handling of Undeliverable Shipments | If UPS is unable to deliver a Worldwide shipment after attempted delivery, it will be processed according to your instructions. The shipper will be charged transport costs plus a surcharge. For EU and domestic shipments, UPS will return the parcel via Standard service (if available), with return transport and fuel costs applied. | €7.30 |

of the scheduled delivery and provide us with the recipient's name, address, shipping date, package weight, and UPS control number. auto_qa_result_summary: The quality audit of customer support ticket resolution indicates that the agent performed exceptionally well in areas such as appropriate opening and closing, correct email format, and effective communication. The agent demonstrated empathy and professionalism, ensuring clear and structured responses. However, there is room for improvement in providing additional assistance to exceed customer expectations.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent open the call within the timeline (6 sec), Introduced self and the brand.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should open the call within 6 seconds of the customer's connection, demonstrating promptness and adherence to timelines.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent responded to the customer within 6 seconds: 'Good evening, thank you for calling InCred Finance. How may I assist you?' This demonstrates promptness.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must introduce themselves clearly, ensuring the customer is aware of who is handling their query.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: While the agent greets and introduces the company, no personal introduction is given. E.g., 'thank you for calling InCred Finance. How may I assist you?' The agent does not mention their own name.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should mention the brand name 'Incred' or 'incredfinance' during the opening, reinforcing the company's identity and professionalism.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent clearly says, 'thank you for calling InCred Finance.' The brand is mentioned in the greeting.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should greet the customer according to the time of day. For example, Good morning, Good afternoon, Good Evening. This shows the proactiveness of the agents.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: In the first line, the agent says, 'Good evening, thank you for calling InCred Finance.' This is an appropriate and proactive greeting.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent do the right party verification?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should complete the right verification promptly without causing unnecessary delays. At least two of the details must be verified. Example of the details are, registered mobile number, Date of Birth, Address, PAN, EMI Amount and Bank account - both inclusive, registered email address, and EMI Amount and Disbursal Amount - both inclusive.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent asks for the registered mobile number and confirms it. However, only one detail is verified and there is no verification of at least two pieces of information as required for security.

category_score_evaluation.legend: If the verification failed, the agent should not proceed with the request, adhere to security protocols, and advise the customer to complete the verification process.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Not Applicable

auto_qa_result.category: Did the Agent follow Hold Procedure(60Sec)on call? Was there dead air(more than 7 secs) or call on mute for more than 7 secs ?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should adhere to the communicated hold duration of 60 seconds, ensuring commitment to timelines.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent asks for the customer's permission and thanks the customer for waiting, e.g., 'Thank you for being on hold sir, I'm sorry for long wait.' However, the agent does not communicate the expected hold duration, and one hold instance is about 4 minutes, exceeding the 60 second guideline.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must avoid prolonged dead air (dead air of not more than 6 seconds) during the interaction, ensuring continuous engagement.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent continues to engage and uses statements like 'Just give me a minute sir, I'm checking.' and 'Thank you for being on hold sir.' There is no sign of extended unaddressed dead air.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must give a refresher if the call is on hold for more than 150 seconds.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: During the long hold, the agent does not provide an update or refresher to the customer. Only after the hold does the agent continue: 'Thank you for being on the line, sir.'

auto_qa_result.category: Agent Call Disconnection

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must confirm the conversation is complete before disconnecting by: (1) explicitly asking if the customer has any other questions or concerns (e.g., 'Is there anything else I can help you with today?'), (2) waiting for customer confirmation that their issue is resolved or they have no further queries, and (3) providing a professional closing statement before disconnecting. Exception: The agent may disconnect immediately without these steps if the customer uses abusive, threatening, or profane language after one warning
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: At the conclusion of the call, the agent did provide a professional closing statement: 'Thank you for calling InCred Finance. Great day, sir.' and 'Thank you, sir.'. However, the agent did not explicitly confirm whether the customer had any additional questions or concerns before disconnecting, nor did they clearly wait for customer confirmation that the issue was resolved. The customer said 'Thank you, thank you,' but the agent missed the step of asking if there was anything else they could help with.

category_score_evaluation.legend: When the customer becomes unresponsive or silent during the call, the agent must make three distinct verbal attempts to re-engage before disconnecting. Each attempt must: (1) directly address the customer with 'Hello', 'Sir/Ma'am', or their name, (2) include a verification question like 'Are you still there?' or 'Can you hear me?', and (3) be spaced 10-15 seconds apart to allow adequate response time. If the customer responds at any point, the agent must resume normal conversation. After the third unanswered attempt, the agent may disconnect with a brief closing statement like 'I'll end the call now. Please call us back when ready.' Exception: The agent may disconnect call if there are clear technical indicators of line disconnection.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Not Applicable

auto_qa_result.category: Did the Agent acknowledge customer concern on call and was apologetic/empathetic?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should promptly acknowledge the customer's concern, demonstrating attentiveness and understanding.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent repeatedly acknowledges the inconvenience, e.g., 'I understand your concern sir...' and 'I'm operating for that kind of inconvenience...'. This indicates attentiveness, but could be more empathetic.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must use appropriate empathy statements whenever Necessary to connect with the customer's emotional state.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent offers some apologies such as, 'I'm operating for that kind of inconvenience...' and 'I'm sorry for long wait,' but the empathy is somewhat mechanical and lacks depth. Still, the agent does attempt to recognize the customer's emotional state.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the Agent avoid interruption and let the customer speak first? Was the agent actively listening to the customer?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must avoid conversation overlap by waiting for the customer to finish speaking before responding.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent waits for the customer to finish their statements before responding, e.g., throughout the troubleshooting dialogue, the customer is allowed to explain in detail.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must demonstrate active listening by acknowledging or paraphrasing the customer's statements appropriately.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent provides acknowledgements such as 'I understand your concern sir...' and repeats the customer's product names and problems, reflecting listening.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should refrain from interrupting the customer throughout the conversation to understand the customer's concern clearly.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent consistently lets the customer finish their comments before replying, as can be seen throughout the dialogue steps.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent behave professionally on the call? (Avoiding Sarcasm, Profanity, Rude tone) and avoid representing the company in a negative way ?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent maintains a professional and neutral tone throughout the entire call, avoiding any inappropriate language including sarcasm, condescension, mockery, profanity, slang, or dismissive remarks. The agent's word choice and delivery should remain respectful even when addressing difficult situations or customer frustrations.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent maintained a professional and neutral tone throughout, using language such as 'I understand your concern sir', 'I'm sorry for long wait', and 'Thank you for calling InCred Finance'. There was no instance of sarcasm, profanity, or disrespectful remarks, even when the customer was clearly frustrated.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent consistently uses polite and courteous language, including appropriate greetings, expressions of empathy (e.g., 'I understand your concern'), gratitude acknowledgments (e.g., 'Thank you for your patience'), and professional closings. The agent actively listens without interrupting and responds with patience and respect throughout the conversation.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent greeted the customer, expressed empathy ('I understand your concern'), thanked the customer for holding, apologized for wait times, and closed the conversation professionally. There were several instances where the agent patiently clarified steps and provided assistance without any sign of impatience.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent avoids making any negative, disparaging, or critical comments about Incred, its policies, processes, products, services, or team members. The agent refrains from statements that could undermine customer confidence, such as blaming the company, expressing frustration with internal systems, or agreeing with customer complaints about Incred in a way that validates criticism.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: At no point did the agent make negative comments about InCred, its processes, or team. The agent expressed regret about any inconvenience ('I'm sorry for long wait', 'I do understand this kind of inconvenience'), but did not blame the company or agree with customer criticism in a manner that would damage company reputation.

auto_qa_result.category: Was the agent fluent, Clearly Audible, energetic, enthusiastic & Confident throughout the call?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should maintain fluency in their speech throughout the call, ensuring smooth and professional communication. The agent should maintain the neutral pace of the conversation and not rush while talking to the customer.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent maintains fluency in responses such as guiding the customer stepwise through app navigation, e.g., 'First initiate the return request sir after that you can able to swap the product...' etc.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should be clearly audible, ensuring the customer can hear and understand all parts of the conversation without asking for repetition.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: There are no requests from the customer to repeat, and the conversation flows smoothly indicating audibility.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should demonstrate consistent energy, confidence, and enthusiasm throughout the call, fostering a positive customer experience.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Agent demonstrates confidence and guides the customer on application processes, e.g., 'I'll guide you the steps to initiate this.' and answers with clarity and assurance.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent switch language as per customer's comfort and maintain the rate of speech ?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must effectively switch to the customer's preferred language to ensure clear communication and comfort.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The entire conversation is carried in English and the customer does not indicate any discomfort with the language.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should maintain a consistent rate of speech, ensuring that the customer can easily follow the conversation.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent gives instructions step by step and the customer follows and responds without showing confusion, indicating a suitable rate of speech.

category_score_evaluation.legend: If the agent and customer cannot communicate due to a language barrier on the call, the agent must offer the customer a callback request.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Not Applicable

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent form accurate sentences with correct pronunciation and Avoid Slangs/Jargons?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent's pronunciation should be clear and accurate, making it easy for the customer to understand.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent generally communicated clearly but some sentences were grammatically incorrect and difficult to understand, such as 'I'm operating for that kind of inconvenience as you can see the subscription activated recently only right as you can see we've been able to swap the product sir'. Other instances, e.g., 'Yes sir, go to unlimited catalog,' are clearly expressed. However, repeated long and unclear sentences reduce overall clarity.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should avoid using slang, colloquial terms, or jargon like SOA, RS, FC, LPP, CBC, EOD, WCL, LOD, and maintain professionalism and clarity throughout the conversation.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent did not use slang or inappropriate jargon throughout the conversation. The term 'unlimited team' and 'unlimited catalog' refer directly to the company's product features and are not inappropriate company-specific jargon here.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should avoid using back-channel cues like 'han', 'hu', 'uh-huh', 'hmm', 'ha', etc., with the customer, as these cues might seem unprofessional to the customer.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent did not use any back-channel cues like 'han', 'hu', 'uh-huh', 'hmm', etc. All responses were formal and professional.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent ask for further assistance?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should ask if the customer requires additional help or has any other questions, demonstrating a willingness to support.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: At no point did the agent specifically ask the customer if any further help or additional questions were needed. The conversation instead moved to a closure after the issue summary and follow-up timeline.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must ensure clarity by offering to escalate, transfer, or follow up if required.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent mentioned putting the customer on hold to check with the 'unlimited team' several times but did not clearly offer to escalate or transfer the call to a supervisor. There were follow-up actions (e.g., 'I'll let you know', 'get in touch tomorrow') but escalation protocol was not specifically mentioned.

auto_qa_result.category: Was the call escalated on request made by the customer/Was the call transfer process followed?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should transfer the call to the supervisor, informing the customer beforehand that they would be connected to a senior person.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Not Applicable

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent is required to suggest a callback to the customer when the senior person is unavailable.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Not Applicable

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent close the call by thanking the customer with branding, as per the script?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should close the call by thanking the customer and mentioning the brand name 'Incred' or 'Incredfinance' as per the script (e.g., 'Thank you for contacting Incred, have a good day.').
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent closed the call by saying, 'Thank you for calling InCred Finance. Great day, sir.' This includes both a thank you and the brand name, adhering to the script requirements.

auto_qa_result_summary: The quality audit of the customer support ticket resolution revealed that the agent demonstrated promptness in opening the call and effectively acknowledged the customer's concerns. However, there were areas for improvement, including the need for a personal introduction, better adherence to verification protocols, and ensuring the customer was asked if they needed further assistance before closing the call. Overall, the agent maintained professionalism and fluency throughout the conversation.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent open the call within the timeline (6 sec), Introduced self and the brand.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should open the call within 6 seconds of the customer's connection, demonstrating promptness and adherence to timelines.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent greeted the customer at the very beginning of the interaction: 'Thank you for calling InCred Finance, Rishi Soma, how may I assist you today?'.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must introduce themselves clearly, ensuring the customer is aware of who is handling their query.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent said, 'Thank you for calling InCred Finance, Rishi Soma, how may I assist you today?', making the introduction clear.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should mention the brand name 'Incred' or 'incredfinance' during the opening, reinforcing the company's identity and professionalism.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent said, 'Thank you for calling InCred Finance...'.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should greet the customer according to the time of day. For example, Good morning, Good afternoon, Good Evening. This shows the proactiveness of the agents.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Although the agent greeted and introduced themselves, there was no time-of-day specific greeting such as 'Good evening'.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent do the right party verification?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should complete the right verification promptly without causing unnecessary delays. At least two of the details must be verified. Example of the details are, registered mobile number, Date of Birth, Address, PAN, EMI Amount and Bank account - both inclusive, registered email address, and EMI Amount and Disbursal Amount - both inclusive.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent went directly into handling the customer's query without confirming the customer's identity or performing any form of right party verification.

category_score_evaluation.legend: If the verification failed, the agent should not proceed with the request, adhere to security protocols, and advise the customer to complete the verification process.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Not Applicable

auto_qa_result.category: Did the Agent follow Hold Procedure(60Sec)on call? Was there dead air(more than 7 secs) or call on mute for more than 7 secs ?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should adhere to the communicated hold duration of 60 seconds, ensuring commitment to timelines.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent said, 'May I please put your call on hold for two minutes, please? I'll check and get back to you.' and later apologized for a 'long hold, ma'am.' The hold lasted about 88 seconds the first time and over 3 minutes before the last update, exceeding the standard 60 seconds.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must avoid prolonged dead air (dead air of not more than 6 seconds) during the interaction, ensuring continuous engagement.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: There is no evidence of unexplained dead air; the agent expressly informed the customer about the wait times related to hold and apologized afterwards.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must give a refresher if the call is on hold for more than 150 seconds.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: After a lengthy hold (over 3 minutes), the agent returned with 'Thank you for being online. Sorry for the long hold, ma'am.' This qualifies as a refresher.

auto_qa_result.category: Agent Call Disconnection

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must confirm the conversation is complete before disconnecting by: (1) explicitly asking if the customer has any other questions or concerns (e.g., 'Is there anything else I can help you with today?'), (2) waiting for customer confirmation that their issue is resolved or they have no further queries, and (3) providing a professional closing statement before disconnecting. Exception: The agent may disconnect immediately without these steps if the customer uses abusive, threatening, or profane language after one warning
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent asked, 'Is there anything else I can assist you with?' and waited for the customer's confirmation ('No, that's it.') before ending the call with a polite closing statement: 'Thank you for calling InCred Finance, ma'am. Have a great day.' On the second section of the call, the agent also closed professionally: 'Thank you for giving your valuable time to InCred. Have a great day ahead, ma'am.' This demonstrates all closure steps were followed.

category_score_evaluation.legend: When the customer becomes unresponsive or silent during the call, the agent must make three distinct verbal attempts to re-engage before disconnecting. Each attempt must: (1) directly address the customer with 'Hello', 'Sir/Ma'am', or their name, (2) include a verification question like 'Are you still there?' or 'Can you hear me?', and (3) be spaced 10-15 seconds apart to allow adequate response time. If the customer responds at any point, the agent must resume normal conversation. After the third unanswered attempt, the agent may disconnect with a brief closing statement like 'I'll end the call now. Please call us back when ready.' Exception: The agent may disconnect call if there are clear technical indicators of line disconnection.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Not Applicable

auto_qa_result.category: Did the Agent acknowledge customer concern on call and was apologetic/empathetic?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should promptly acknowledge the customer's concern, demonstrating attentiveness and understanding.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Agent said, 'I understand, ma'am. I'll check with the warehouse team.' and 'I'm so sorry. Please wait, okay?', demonstrating acknowledgment of the situation.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must use appropriate empathy statements whenever Necessary to connect with the customer's emotional state.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Agent said, 'I'm so sorry. Please wait, okay?' and also 'Sorry for the long hold, ma'am.' reflecting empathy and understanding.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the Agent avoid interruption and let the customer speak first? Was the agent actively listening to the customer?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must avoid conversation overlap by waiting for the customer to finish speaking before responding.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: There is no evidence of interruption; the agent allows the customer to explain their concern at length before responding at each turn.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must demonstrate active listening by acknowledging or paraphrasing the customer's statements appropriately.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent confirmed the details asked about tomorrow's slot and restated and checked details with the warehouse team. For example, 'Ma'am, you can expect it between 4 p.m. to 7 p.m. tomorrow.'

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should refrain from interrupting the customer throughout the conversation to understand the customer's concern clearly.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: No interruptions were present throughout; the flow of conversation was balanced, letting the customer finish.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent behave professionally on the call? (Avoiding Sarcasm, Profanity, Rude tone) and avoid representing the company in a negative way ?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent maintains a professional and neutral tone throughout the entire call, avoiding any inappropriate language including sarcasm, condescension, mockery, profanity, slang, or dismissive remarks. The agent's word choice and delivery should remain respectful even when addressing difficult situations or customer frustrations.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Throughout the call, the agent addressed the customer respectfully with phrases like 'Thank you for calling,' 'I understand, ma'am,' and avoided any inappropriate language, sarcasm, or rude tone, even when discussing difficult scheduling constraints ('Actually, for tomorrow it is difficult.').

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent consistently uses polite and courteous language, including appropriate greetings, expressions of empathy (e.g., 'I understand your concern'), gratitude acknowledgments (e.g., 'Thank you for your patience'), and professional closings. The agent actively listens without interrupting and responds with patience and respect throughout the conversation.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent offered polite greetings ('Thank you for calling InCred Finance…'), empathy ('I understand, ma'am'), and gratitude ('Thank you, ma'am. Thank you so much for your patience.'). The agent waited for the customer to finish speaking and responded thoughtfully without interruptions.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent avoids making any negative, disparaging, or critical comments about Incred, its policies, processes, products, services, or team members. The agent refrains from statements that could undermine customer confidence, such as blaming the company, expressing frustration with internal systems, or agreeing with customer complaints about Incred in a way that validates criticism.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent refrained from any negative comments about InCred or its internal processes. When facing customer concerns about scheduling and pickups, the agent responded factually and constructively ('I have already escalated…'), not blaming or criticizing the company.

auto_qa_result.category: Was the agent fluent, Clearly Audible, energetic, enthusiastic & Confident throughout the call?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should maintain fluency in their speech throughout the call, ensuring smooth and professional communication. The agent should maintain the neutral pace of the conversation and not rush while talking to the customer.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Agent responses were coherent, clear, and without indications of rushed or broken speech. Example: 'Thank you for calling InCred Finance, Rishi Soma, how may I assist you today?'.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should be clearly audible, ensuring the customer can hear and understand all parts of the conversation without asking for repetition.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: There was no indication from the customer of any issue hearing or understanding the agent. The exchange was smooth.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should demonstrate consistent energy, confidence, and enthusiasm throughout the call, fostering a positive customer experience.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Phrases like 'Thank you for calling InCred Finance' and providing future escalation steps reflect a positive and confident manner.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent switch language as per customer's comfort and maintain the rate of speech ?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must effectively switch to the customer's preferred language to ensure clear communication and comfort.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: English was used throughout, matching the customer's communication; there was no need for a language switch.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should maintain a consistent rate of speech, ensuring that the customer can easily follow the conversation.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Consistent pacing was observed, and the customer never expressed difficulty in following the conversation.

category_score_evaluation.legend: If the agent and customer cannot communicate due to a language barrier on the call, the agent must offer the customer a callback request.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Not Applicable

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent form accurate sentences with correct pronunciation and Avoid Slangs/Jargons?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent's pronunciation should be clear and accurate, making it easy for the customer to understand.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent's sentences are generally clear and understandable, such as 'Thank you for calling InCred Finance, Rishi Soma, how may I assist you today?' However, there are several minor grammatical flaws and some awkward phrasing, for example, 'I have speak with the team, but they are unavailable.' Despite this, overall meaning is conveyed with reasonable clarity.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should avoid using slang, colloquial terms, or jargon like SOA, RS, FC, LPP, CBC, EOD, WCL, LOD, and maintain professionalism and clarity throughout the conversation.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Throughout the conversation, the agent avoids slang, abbreviations or internal jargon. All communication remains professional and easy to understand for the customer.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should avoid using back-channel cues like 'han', 'hu', 'uh-huh', 'hmm', 'ha', etc., with the customer, as these cues might seem unprofessional to the customer.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent does not use informal back-channel cues like 'han', 'uh-huh', etc., instead using phrases like 'Yes, please' and 'Thank you for holding.' This maintains professionalism.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent ask for further assistance?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should ask if the customer requires additional help or has any other questions, demonstrating a willingness to support.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent directly asks, 'Is there anything else I can assist you with?' after providing the resolution, clearly offering further support.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must ensure clarity by offering to escalate, transfer, or follow up if required.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent says, 'let me check with the warehouse team', 'I have already escalated', and suggests the customer call back if action is not taken. While the agent does describe escalating and keep the customer informed, transfer to a supervisor or offering a definitive follow up is not explicitly mentioned.

auto_qa_result.category: Was the call escalated on request made by the customer/Was the call transfer process followed?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should transfer the call to the supervisor, informing the customer beforehand that they would be connected to a senior person.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Not Applicable

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent is required to suggest a callback to the customer when the senior person is unavailable.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent says, 'if it is not getting added then... kindly escalate tomorrow morning one more time after 10:00 so that we can check with the team.' This effectively suggests a callback when the team is unavailable.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent close the call by thanking the customer with branding, as per the script?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should close the call by thanking the customer and mentioning the brand name 'Incred' or 'Incredfinance' as per the script (e.g., 'Thank you for contacting Incred, have a good day.').
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent thanks the customer and brands, saying: 'Thank you for calling InCred Finance, ma'am. Have a great day.' and 'Thank you for giving your valuable time to InCred. Have a great day ahead, ma'am.' This fulfills script requirements.

auto_qa_result_summary: The quality audit of the customer support ticket resolution revealed that the agent performed well in several areas, including promptness in opening the call, professional behavior, and effective communication. However, the agent failed to conduct proper right party verification, which is a critical security measure. Overall, the agent demonstrated empathy and active listening, but there were some areas for improvement, particularly in adherence to hold procedures and ensuring clarity in communication.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent open the call within the timeline (6 sec), Introduced self and the brand.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should open the call within 6 seconds of the customer's connection, demonstrating promptness and adherence to timelines.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent greeted and started the conversation at 00:03, demonstrating promptness by opening the call within the required 6 seconds: 'Thank you for calling InCred Finance, this is Shiva, how may I assist you?'

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must introduce themselves clearly, ensuring the customer is aware of who is handling their query.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent provided a clear self-introduction: 'Thank you for calling InCred Finance, this is Shiva, how may I assist you?'

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should mention the brand name 'Incred' or 'incredfinance' during the opening, reinforcing the company's identity and professionalism.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: In the opening statement, the agent says: 'Thank you for calling InCred Finance, this is Shiva...'

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should greet the customer according to the time of day. For example, Good morning, Good afternoon, Good Evening. This shows the proactiveness of the agents.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent greeted with 'Thank you for calling InCred Finance' but did not use a time-specific greeting such as 'Good morning' or 'Good afternoon.'

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent do the right party verification?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should complete the right verification promptly without causing unnecessary delays. At least two of the details must be verified. Example of the details are, registered mobile number, Date of Birth, Address, PAN, EMI Amount and Bank account - both inclusive, registered email address, and EMI Amount and Disbursal Amount - both inclusive.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent asks for the registered mobile number and verifies the registered name from system records: 'Sir, can you please help me out with the registered mobile number...' and 'Sir, registered name is Rohit right sir?'. Two data points (mobile and name) were confirmed.

category_score_evaluation.legend: If the verification failed, the agent should not proceed with the request, adhere to security protocols, and advise the customer to complete the verification process.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The verification was successful; thus, no need for refusal or additional advisories. The agent asks and confirms details: 'Sir, can you please help me out with the registered mobile number...' followed by confirmation, and proceeds after verifying the name.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the Agent follow Hold Procedure(60Sec)on call? Was there dead air(more than 7 secs) or call on mute for more than 7 secs ?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should adhere to the communicated hold duration of 60 seconds, ensuring commitment to timelines.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent said, 'can I place the call on hold for two minutes please' and placed the customer on hold. The hold lasted over 2 minutes and 20 seconds (from 02:15 to 04:37), which exceeds the standard 60 seconds for initial hold.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must avoid prolonged dead air (dead air of not more than 6 seconds) during the interaction, ensuring continuous engagement.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: There is dead air from 02:17 to 04:37 when the agent returns. While the hold is explained, the dead air was longer than ideal and no periodic updates were given.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must give a refresher if the call is on hold for more than 150 seconds.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent did not provide a refresher or check in with the customer during the long hold from 02:17 to 04:37 (over 2 minutes 20 seconds).

auto_qa_result.category: Agent Call Disconnection

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must confirm the conversation is complete before disconnecting by: (1) explicitly asking if the customer has any other questions or concerns (e.g., 'Is there anything else I can help you with today?'), (2) waiting for customer confirmation that their issue is resolved or they have no further queries, and (3) providing a professional closing statement before disconnecting. Exception: The agent may disconnect immediately without these steps if the customer uses abusive, threatening, or profane language after one warning
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent asks, 'Is there anything else I can help you with sir?' and waits for the customer's negative response before stating, 'Thank you for calling InCred Finance, have a great day.' In the latter part, the agent asks again, 'Is there anything else that I can help you out sir?' and after the customer confirms, provides a closing: 'Thank you sir, you have a permanent health insurance sir.' This fulfills the requirements of confirming the conversation is complete and providing a closing statement.

category_score_evaluation.legend: When the customer becomes unresponsive or silent during the call, the agent must make three distinct verbal attempts to re-engage before disconnecting. Each attempt must: (1) directly address the customer with 'Hello', 'Sir/Ma'am', or their name, (2) include a verification question like 'Are you still there?' or 'Can you hear me?', and (3) be spaced 10-15 seconds apart to allow adequate response time. If the customer responds at any point, the agent must resume normal conversation. After the third unanswered attempt, the agent may disconnect with a brief closing statement like 'I'll end the call now. Please call us back when ready.' Exception: The agent may disconnect call if there are clear technical indicators of line disconnection.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Not Applicable

auto_qa_result.category: Did the Agent acknowledge customer concern on call and was apologetic/empathetic?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should promptly acknowledge the customer's concern, demonstrating attentiveness and understanding.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent acknowledges the concern by saying, 'Please allow me a moment' and later assures, 'I kindly requested to please wait so that we will be checking with the location of your address... we will be providing you the confirmation sir.'

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must use appropriate empathy statements whenever Necessary to connect with the customer's emotional state.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent uses polite, understanding language: 'Sir, thank you for staying on the line' and 'I kindly requested to please wait...' Although friendly, the agent could have had more explicit empathy (e.g., 'I understand this is concerning for you').

auto_qa_result.category: Did the Agent avoid interruption and let the customer speak first? Was the agent actively listening to the customer?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must avoid conversation overlap by waiting for the customer to finish speaking before responding.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent consistently waits for the customer to finish before replying, such as after the customer's questions at 'Madam ye red zone aya location ki vajah se aya hai?' the agent responds after the customer is finished.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must demonstrate active listening by acknowledging or paraphrasing the customer's statements appropriately.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent frequently acknowledges what the customer says ('Yeah yeah, you are audible sir.' and paraphrases the concern regarding the address and red zone).

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should refrain from interrupting the customer throughout the conversation to understand the customer's concern clearly.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: There is no sign of the agent cutting off or interrupting the customer. The agent's responses come after the customer completes statements.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent behave professionally on the call? (Avoiding Sarcasm, Profanity, Rude tone) and avoid representing the company in a negative way ?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent maintains a professional and neutral tone throughout the entire call, avoiding any inappropriate language including sarcasm, condescension, mockery, profanity, slang, or dismissive remarks. The agent's word choice and delivery should remain respectful even when addressing difficult situations or customer frustrations.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Throughout the conversation, the agent remains polite and respectful, uses professional language such as 'Thank you for calling', and addresses the customer politely ('sir', 'please'). There is no sarcasm, profanity, or rude language present.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent consistently uses polite and courteous language, including appropriate greetings, expressions of empathy (e.g., 'I understand your concern'), gratitude acknowledgments (e.g., 'Thank you for your patience'), and professional closings. The agent actively listens without interrupting and responds with patience and respect throughout the conversation.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent opens the call courteously ('Thank you for calling InCred Finance, this is Shiva, how may I assist you?'), thanks the customer ('Thank you'), checks for additional queries, and closes professionally. The tone remains empathic and there are no interruptions or signs of impatience.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent avoids making any negative, disparaging, or critical comments about Incred, its policies, processes, products, services, or team members. The agent refrains from statements that could undermine customer confidence, such as blaming the company, expressing frustration with internal systems, or agreeing with customer complaints about Incred in a way that validates criticism.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent maintains company neutrality even when the customer refers to developer errors or red zone status. The agent says, 'we are checking sir,' and keeps responses factual, avoids agreeing with negative comments, and does not blame InCred.

auto_qa_result.category: Was the agent fluent, Clearly Audible, energetic, enthusiastic & Confident throughout the call?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should maintain fluency in their speech throughout the call, ensuring smooth and professional communication. The agent should maintain the neutral pace of the conversation and not rush while talking to the customer.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent's messages are fluent and clear during the conversation. For example, 'So, as per the update, your file is in verification process. So, it will be taking another 24 to 48 hours.'

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should be clearly audible, ensuring the customer can hear and understand all parts of the conversation without asking for repetition.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent checks mutual audibility: 'Yeah yeah, you are audible sir. Am I audible to you?' indicating ongoing clarity of the call.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should demonstrate consistent energy, confidence, and enthusiasm throughout the call, fostering a positive customer experience.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent maintains a polite and confident tone, such as during the call opening and providing updates; however, enthusiasm is at a polite but neutral level.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent switch language as per customer's comfort and maintain the rate of speech ?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must effectively switch to the customer's preferred language to ensure clear communication and comfort.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent uses some Hindi ('warehouse team se check kar rahe hain sir') but primarily communicates in English, providing enough comfort for a bilingual customer.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should maintain a consistent rate of speech, ensuring that the customer can easily follow the conversation.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: All agent replies are delivered in a steady manner, with customers replying and understanding each statement without notable confusion.

category_score_evaluation.legend: If the agent and customer cannot communicate due to a language barrier on the call, the agent must offer the customer a callback request.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: Not Applicable

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent form accurate sentences with correct pronunciation and Avoid Slangs/Jargons?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent's pronunciation should be clear and accurate, making it easy for the customer to understand.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent generally spoke in clear English but there were some areas where the sentence structure was awkward and could confuse the customer. For example, phrases like 'So regarding this reading, there is any update on the table.' and 'Is it Paytm number sir, or the different one?' sound unnatural and could create confusion, affecting clarity.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should avoid using slang, colloquial terms, or jargon like SOA, RS, FC, LPP, CBC, EOD, WCL, LOD, and maintain professionalism and clarity throughout the conversation.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent avoided explicit jargon or slang such as SOA, RS, FC, etc. throughout the call. The language used was generally professional, with no use of undocumented abbreviations or colloquialisms.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should avoid using back-channel cues like 'han', 'hu', 'uh-huh', 'hmm', 'ha', etc., with the customer, as these cues might seem unprofessional to the customer.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent did not use unprofessional back-channel cues such as 'han', 'hmm', or similar. The responses were mostly clear and direct, e.g. 'Yes sir', 'Okay sir'.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the agent ask for further assistance?

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent should ask if the customer requires additional help or has any other questions, demonstrating a willingness to support.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent proactively asked 'Is there anything else I can help you with sir?' and repeated similar offers for further assistance at the end of the main and follow-up calls.

category_score_evaluation.legend: The agent must ensure clarity by offering to escalate, transfer, or follow up if required.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent stated, 'I have informed to the warehouse team sir. So I kindly requested to please wait so that we will be checking...' indicating the issue was being followed up, but there was no explicit offer of escalation or a formal follow-up call, reducing clarity about next steps.

category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent stated, 'Thank you for calling InCred Finance, have a great day.' thereby fulfilling the requirement of thanking the customer and providing the brand name as specified.
